result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott S. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft from a Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.81.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott S. Jones in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville. Defendant Scott S. Jones in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-128 and 14CM-129.

1:39 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Both files are before the Court today for a sentence after revocation.

Court has received the revocation summary, was provided to the parties.

Parties did receive their copy.

There is no reason why this Defendant should not be sentenced today.

Neither party have witnesses to present.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, Agent Hytry is present if there are any questions, there is an agreement as to the amout of jail credit.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

There are no witnesses that wish to make a statement.

Atty Knaapen adderesses the Court regarding sentencing.
Defendant is in custody on a child support matter. 

Atty Belville addresses the Court regarding sentencing.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties. 
Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court finds agent's report thorough and complete and thoughtfully done.

Agenty Hytry addresses the Court regarding boot camp.

14CF-128:
Count 7:
Determinate prison sentence for  a period of 4 years
Initial Confinement of 2 years
Extended Supervision of 2 years
141 days credit towards the 2 year period
Consecutive to any sentence Defendant is now serving
Eligible for challenge incarceration but only after serving 1 year, which includes the 141 days credit
Not eligible for earned release
Conditions:
Comply with any assessments and counseling as recommended by the agent
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances  without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Fill all presciptions at one pharmacy, disclose to agent, sign necessary releases
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and controlled substances. 
Sign releases for AODA so agent can monitor.
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay restitution surcharge
Pay restitution
Pay victim witness surcharge

14CM-129:
Count 1:
9 Months Jail concurrent to 14CF-128
141 days credit
Consecutive to sentence Defendant is currently serving
Pay costs and surcharges
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay victim witness surcharge

Count 4:
9 Months Jail concurrent to Count 1 and concurrent to 14CF-128
141 days credit
Consecutive to sentence Defendant is currently serving
Pay costs and surcharges
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay victim witness surcharge



These costs/surcharges/restitution are to be paid out of prison account at rate of 25%, on these cases.
Restitution is to be added as a condition of extended supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott S Jones in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CM467, 14CF128, 14CM129, 13CT335

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF128 Count 7 - NO CONTEST
14CM129 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
14CM129 Count 4 - NO CONTEST
13CT335 - NO CONTEST
13CM467 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty to the following and the Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date:
14CF128 Count 7 
14CM129 Count 1 
14CM129 Count 4 
13CT335 
13CM467 

DISMISSED AND READ-IN:
14CF128 Counts 1 thru 6 
14CM129 Counts 2 & 3

Court questions Atty Renc re: PSI. 
Defendant agrees to proceed without a PSI. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  No victims are present. 
Court and both counsel have received the ATTIC report. 
Court questions Atty Renc. 

BY THE COURT:

Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of: 24 months
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and controlled substances.

Sign releases for AODA so agent can monitor.

No contact with Kayla Clark or Wanda Clark or account holder at the bank except as required for purposes of child placement and issues involving the children, then no abusive contact. 
Pay costs. 

14CM129 counts 1 & 4:
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of:24months concurrent with 14cF128
Pay costs including DNA surcharge. 
Comply with conditions in 14CF128.

Huber for work and counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
